H0.text: High altitude above sea level causes the alpine tundra to be so cold.

H1.text: Moderate altitude causes the alpine tundra to be so cold.

H2.text: Low altitude causes the alpine tundra to be so cold.

H3.text: Low air density at high elevations causes the alpine tundra to be so cold.

A4.text: The high elevation causes an adverse climate, which is too cold and windy to support tree growth.

A5.text: air tends to get colder as it rises, since it expands.
